faqs.question: Ist die Costa Blanca ein guter Ort zum Immobilienkauf?
faqs.answer: Yes, Costa Blanca remains one of Spain's strongest property investment destinations. The region experiences consistent 6-8% annual appreciation, established tourism infrastructure drives reliable rental income, and international buyer demand remains strong. Benijofar specifically offers undersaturated market conditions with growing investment recognition.

faqs.question: Können Ausländer Immobilien in Spanien kaufen?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can purchase property in Spain without restrictions. Non-resident status doesn't prevent ownership. You'll need a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), which the developer or real estate agent facilitates during purchase. Legal support ensures compliance with Spanish property law and registration requirements.

faqs.question: Welche Kosten fallen beim Immobilienkauf in Spanien an?
faqs.answer: Purchase costs typically total 6-8% above the property price: transfer tax (6-10% in Alicante region), notary fees (0.5-1%), registry fees (0.1%), and agent commissions (3-5% typically paid by seller). Legal representation costs €500-1,500. Budget total acquisition costs at €339,000 around €20,000-27,000 additional expenses.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Grundsteuern in Spanien?
faqs.answer: Die jährlichen Grundsteuern (IBI) in Benijofar typically run €300-500 depending on official property valuation. Non-resident additional income tax applies to rental income at 19-24% rate. Community fees for this development average €60-80 monthly. Property tax represents approximately 0.1% annual property value—substantially below UK council tax equivalents.

faqs.question: Kann ich als Ausländer eine Hypothek in Spanien bekommen?
faqs.answer: Yes, major Spanish banks offer mortgages to non-residents. Typical terms provide 70-80% loan-to-value financing over 20-30 years. Interest rates for non-residents run 0.5-1% higher than resident rates. Applicant requirements include income verification and proof of funds for down payment. British and other international banks also finance Spanish properties.

faqs.question: Wie hoch sind die Lebenshaltungskosten an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Living costs in Benijofar run substantially below UK and northern European equivalents. Food, utilities, and services cost 20-30% less than UK averages. A comfortable couple budget €1,200-1,500 monthly including accommodation. Restaurant meals cost €8-15 for quality dining. Retirees and investors benefit from purchasing power advantages that maximize income in southern Spain.

faqs.question: Wie ist das Wetter an der Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: Costa Blanca enjoys Mediterranean climate with 300+ sunshine days annually. Summer temperatures reach 28-32°C (June-September). Winter temperatures hover 10-16°C—mild with occasional rain. Benijofar's inland position avoids coastal humidity while remaining accessible to beaches. Consistent weather creates ideal rental season duration extending through shoulder seasons that coastal areas experience.

faqs.question: Welche Mieteinnahmen kann ich von dieser Immobilie erwarten?
faqs.answer: Comparable 4-bedroom apartments in Benijofar command €700-900 weekly during peak season (June-September) and €400-600 off-season. Conservative annual calculations assuming 65% occupancy show €40,000-45,000 gross rental income, representing 12-13% gross yield. Net yields after tax, community fees, and management average 7-8% annually—competitive returns for European real estate.

faqs.question: Is Benijofar suitable for holiday letting?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Benijofar attracts families and groups seeking authentic Spanish experience within driving distance of beaches, golf, and cultural attractions. The established expat community provides consistent tenant referrals. Platform availability through Airbnb, Vrbo, and local agencies ensures marketing reach. 4-bedroom configuration perfectly suits holiday groups typically renting weekly, generating maximum revenue per property.
